div.p:
To the Chairman of the Committee of the Technologic Museum
For reply see M. Clarke to M, 11 January 1871 (in this edition as 71-01-11c).

I have the honor to draw your attention to the circumstance, that as yet the majority of my articles, which came back from the Sydney Exhibition,
Metropolitan Intercolonial Exhibition, Sydney, 1870. are left (as far as I am aware) in the annex of the Industrial Museum building.

In a very lengthened communication, sent to the Commission many weeks ago,
See M to R. Barry, 4 November 1870.
I had the honor of pointing out, that part of these Exhibits are my private property, (purchased on my private expense) and an other portion is only a duplicate collection of tars, acids, woodspirit, oils &c, such as we have already in the Museum here.

The object of ordering these articles back was mainly or solely, to use them for the London Exhibition,
First Annual International Exhibition, London, 1871. and I have now the honor to ask the permission of sending these goods to Mr Verdon by the Great Britain or the next ship, as otherwise the sending will not be right time in London.
